titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry M. Crydenwise papers, 1861-1867
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters describing Civil War experiences in Florida and South Carolina with the 90th New York Infantry Regiment, subsequent service in the 96th United States Regiment (Colored) and th Corps D'Afrique, and post-war employment as an overseer on a large plantation near Vicksburg, Miss.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Henry M. Crydenwise Papers, 1861-1867, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Henry M. Crydenwise was an African American Union soldier, member of the 90th New York Infantry Regiment; from Otsego County, N.Y.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters describing Civil War experiences in Florida and South Carolina with the 90th New York Infantry Regiment, subsequent service in the 96th United States Regiment (Colored) and th Corps D'Afrique, and post-war employment as an overseer on a large plantation near Vicksburg, Miss.
